dismissalText.long: c Tilak Varma b Mohammed Shami
dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy c Tilak Varma b Mohammed Shami 54 (81b 5x4 2x6 99m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: taken at deep square leg! That went pretty high, and was heading towards the longer side of the ground too. This time Tilak settles under it after watching it well. Shami bowled on a back of a length around outside off, but the ball bounced only up to the waist of the batter. Hridoy still went ahead with a pull which resembled more a swipe, only to get it off the top half of the bat

dismissalComment.html: edged to slip! Axar pulled his length back to be a bit short, and also found turn away from the right-hander. Mehidy poked at it almost tentatively, and ended up giving a catch low to Rohit's right. The ball was on the shorter side of a length outside off, and moving away, with Mehidy not able to resist it

dismissalText.commentary: Shamim Hossain lbw b Jadeja 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: No. 200 for Jadeja. Well he will have to wait for a confirmation as Shamim has reviewed the lbw. Playing back to a quick delivery, which pitches around off and turns back in to beat the inside edge and hit his pad. Three reds, and Jadeja has 200 ODI wickets

dismissalText.commentary: Nasum Ahmed b Prasidh Krishna 44 (45b 6x4 1x6 53m) SR: 97.77

dismissalComment.html: plays on! Prasidh floats one at only 95kph, and gets a reward. A bottom edge went on to tickle the leg stump, as a handy stand comes to an end. Prasidh bowled that quite full, angling it across and ending up bowling quite full and wide of off. Nasum went pushing at it away from his body - it almost took ages to come - and ended up chopping it back

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill c Towhid Hridoy b Mahedi Hasan 121 (133b 8x4 5x6 185m) SR: 90.97

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off! The change in angle works, as does the change in line from Mahedi. He tossed it up, and bowled full and wide of off. Gill went after another big hit, in the process flat-batting his attempted loft over long-off. The fielder moved a bit to his right, and gobbled that to shock India

dismissalText.long: c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 42 (34b 3x4 2x6 61m) SR: 123.52

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off rushing forward! Good catch, and this is a big setback for India. It was another cutter from Mustafizur, who went full and a bit wide of off. The roll of the wrists worked though, as Axar went lofting down the pitch. Not sure he really needed to do that though, given he just hit a four, and India hardly had wickets. But in the end, a a good catch by Tanzid

headshotImage.caption: RA Jadeja headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RA Jadeja headshot

dismissalComment.html: swings and misses! Jadeja looked to go big by heaving across the line, but was beaten as his middle stump was uprooted. It wasn't a slower ball or a change of pace either, with Mustafizur going on the shorter side of a length, while angling it into the left-hander. The ball came in, Jadeja missed, and bang went the middle stump

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: low full toss on middle, and flicked right to the man at square leg. Easy catch for Mehidy, but hang on... even as Thakur is walking back, the two umpires converge and have a discussion. No, it was all for nothing. Thakur is out. There was only one man placed inside the circle in that region, and Thakur found him. Ideally, this should have been dispatched, but Thakur finally runs out of luck

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off rushing forward! Good catch, and this is a big setback for India. It was another cutter from Mustafizur, who went full and a bit wide of off. The roll of the wrists worked though, as Axar went lofting down the pitch. Not sure he really needed to do that though, given he just hit a four, and India hardly had wickets. But in the end, a a good catch by Tanzid

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami run out (Tanzid Hasan/†Litton Das) 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: fires a yorker bang on middle, and Shami jams it down to fine leg. They try a second run, and Shami is run-out. They had little option but to go for that run, as the throw arrived bang close to the stumps at the striker's end. Litton whipped the bails off with Shami not even in the frame. Bangladesh beat India by six runs

commentPostTextItems.html: So Bangladesh fight their way to a close win despite Gill's 121. India's batting line-up, missing only Kohli among the regulars, fell just short of chasing 266 to give Bangladesh a consolation win. Sidharth Monga's report details the rest of it. Now there's only one match to go in this year's Asia Cup. Sri Lanka will host India in the final on Sunday. But before that comes, you can also follow New Zealand's chase against England, and Australia's attempt to climb Mount 417 vs South Africa. Until next time, this is Himanshu signing off on behalf of Monga, Thilak and Raghav! Good night!
Geo: "It is not as if this is a completely second-string Indian team - other than Tilak and Prasidh, everyone else has loads of experience with them....so it is very, very good for Bangladesh!"

Shakib Al Hasan is the Player of the Match: "We gave [chances] to the guys who haven't played much. We thought spinners will play a part, and luckily they did. I wasn't batting well during this Asia Cup, but today I had time to settle. When I hit my first boundary, it felt good. When the ball got older, spin was difficult to play. When Mahedi came on, it wasn't easy to bowl. He bowled five overs in a row in the end. I should give credit to Sakib (Tanzim) also. I think we have got a very good team [for the World Cup]. Lot of injuries, and players coming in and going out didn't help during this Asia Cup."
Zia: "@Habib: don't forget about Shanto and Ebadot"
Habib: "With their top pace trio (Taskin, Hasan Mahmud and Shoriful), Tamim and Mushfiq missing, it's a big win for Bangladesh."

Rohit Sharma after the tight loss: "We wanted to give some game time to the guys, keeping the bigger picture in mind. Not compromising on how we wanted to play this game. Get in some players who are likely to play the World Cup. Axar batted brilliantly, but couldn't finish. He showed a lot of character. But credit to the Bangladesh bowlers. Not to forget, Gill's hundred was brilliant. He backs his game; he knows exactly how he wants to play. Pretty clear on what he wants to do for the team. Look at his form over the last year. Pretty solid against the new ball. Works really hard; there's no optional practice for Gill."

Tanzim Hasan: "First wicket of Rohit bhai was a dream wicket. I just concentrate on line and length. I mentally prepare myself for a long spell. That ball (the last ball to Shami), I believed I could bowl the perfect ball. Very good feeling."

11.04pm Another nail-biter from Colombo. Bangladesh edge past India - the third time in four matches between the teams that the result has gone Bangladesh's way - even as India happily experimented after having already made the Asia Cup final. But take nothing away from Bangladesh: they were without Mushfiqur and Taskin, having already been hit by injuries earlier in the tournament. A win too late perhaps, but still a confidence booster ahead of the World Cup. Hang around for the presentations.

dismissalComment.html: edged to slip! Axar pulled his length back to be a bit short, and also found turn away from the right-hander. Mehidy poked at it almost tentatively, and ended up giving a catch low to Rohit's right. The ball was on the shorter side of a length outside off, and moving away, with Mehidy not able to resist it

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammed Shami headshot

dismissalText.long: c Tilak Varma b Mohammed Shami
dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy c Tilak Varma b Mohammed Shami 54 (81b 5x4 2x6 99m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: taken at deep square leg! That went pretty high, and was heading towards the longer side of the ground too. This time Tilak settles under it after watching it well. Shami bowled on a back of a length around outside off, but the ball bounced only up to the waist of the batter. Hridoy still went ahead with a pull which resembled more a swipe, only to get it off the top half of the bat

dismissalText.commentary: Nasum Ahmed b Prasidh Krishna 44 (45b 6x4 1x6 53m) SR: 97.77

dismissalComment.html: plays on! Prasidh floats one at only 95kph, and gets a reward. A bottom edge went on to tickle the leg stump, as a handy stand comes to an end. Prasidh bowled that quite full, angling it across and ending up bowling quite full and wide of off. Nasum went pushing at it away from his body - it almost took ages to come - and ended up chopping it back

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (12b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: swings and misses! Jadeja looked to go big by heaving across the line, but was beaten as his middle stump was uprooted. It wasn't a slower ball or a change of pace either, with Mustafizur going on the shorter side of a length, while angling it into the left-hander. The ball came in, Jadeja missed, and bang went the middle stump

dismissalText.long: c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 42 (34b 3x4 2x6 61m) SR: 123.52

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off rushing forward! Good catch, and this is a big setback for India. It was another cutter from Mustafizur, who went full and a bit wide of off. The roll of the wrists worked though, as Axar went lofting down the pitch. Not sure he really needed to do that though, given he just hit a four, and India hardly had wickets. But in the end, a a good catch by Tanzid

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman 11 (13b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: low full toss on middle, and flicked right to the man at square leg. Easy catch for Mehidy, but hang on... even as Thakur is walking back, the two umpires converge and have a discussion. No, it was all for nothing. Thakur is out. There was only one man placed inside the circle in that region, and Thakur found him. Ideally, this should have been dispatched, but Thakur finally runs out of luck

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami run out (Tanzid Hasan/†Litton Das) 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: fires a yorker bang on middle, and Shami jams it down to fine leg. They try a second run, and Shami is run-out. They had little option but to go for that run, as the throw arrived bang close to the stumps at the striker's end. Litton whipped the bails off with Shami not even in the frame. Bangladesh beat India by six runs

dismissalComment.html: big fish. Rohit Sharma for a duck. Teasing wide delivery. Rohit has a drive at it. Early into the shot so he kind of checks his shot. Ends up lobbing it up to cover-point

dismissalText.commentary: Suryakumar Yadav b Shakib Al Hasan 26 (34b 3x4 0x6 37m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! This was almost coming, considering how Surya has consistently looked to sweep anything and everything Shakib has been throwing at him. Shakib dangled one up on a length again on middle and off, getting it to turn away considerably - like he has almost each time he has slowed down his pace. Surya was into his sweep early, and the ball tickled the off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (12b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: swings and misses! Jadeja looked to go big by heaving across the line, but was beaten as his middle stump was uprooted. It wasn't a slower ball or a change of pace either, with Mustafizur going on the shorter side of a length, while angling it into the left-hander. The ball came in, Jadeja missed, and bang went the middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill c Towhid Hridoy b Mahedi Hasan 121 (133b 8x4 5x6 185m) SR: 90.97

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off! The change in angle works, as does the change in line from Mahedi. He tossed it up, and bowled full and wide of off. Gill went after another big hit, in the process flat-batting his attempted loft over long-off. The fielder moved a bit to his right, and gobbled that to shock India

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman 11 (13b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: low full toss on middle, and flicked right to the man at square leg. Easy catch for Mehidy, but hang on... even as Thakur is walking back, the two umpires converge and have a discussion. No, it was all for nothing. Thakur is out. There was only one man placed inside the circle in that region, and Thakur found him. Ideally, this should have been dispatched, but Thakur finally runs out of luck

dismissalText.long: c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel c Tanzid Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 42 (34b 3x4 2x6 61m) SR: 123.52

dismissalComment.html: taken by long-off rushing forward! Good catch, and this is a big setback for India. It was another cutter from Mustafizur, who went full and a bit wide of off. The roll of the wrists worked though, as Axar went lofting down the pitch. Not sure he really needed to do that though, given he just hit a four, and India hardly had wickets. But in the end, a a good catch by Tanzid

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami run out (Tanzid Hasan/†Litton Das) 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: fires a yorker bang on middle, and Shami jams it down to fine leg. They try a second run, and Shami is run-out. They had little option but to go for that run, as the throw arrived bang close to the stumps at the striker's end. Litton whipped the bails off with Shami not even in the frame. Bangladesh beat India by six runs
